body_content.explanation: a small, round doughnut (= a circular cake fried in hot fat), often made from the part cut out of the middle of a larger, ring-shaped doughnut:
examples: There is a chocolate fountain with strawberries, doughnut holes, marshmallows, and pretzels for dipping.

body_content.explanation: for people on a particular kind of Medicare plan for prescription drugs (= ones that can only be bought if a doctor orders them for you), the fact of having to pay for a drug because its cost is between two levels at which the cost will be paid by their plan:
examples: The doughnut hole is the gap in coverage when Part D members reach $2,250 in prescription costs.
The former congressman said his group had made several proposals to Congress for shrinking the doughnut hole.
